org.magnos.util
Class EnumState<E extends java.lang.Enum<E>>

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.util.EnumState<E>

public class EnumState<E extends java.lang.Enum<E>>
extends java.lang.Object

A Thread-safe Finite State Machine utility. The control of he states this machine holds is the responsibility of the developer. This machine can hold one state at a time. Invokers can wait for states to be reached, and can timeout if a maximum wait time is given.

Example Usage

 public enum ProcessState {
        Initialized, Running, Stopped, Error, Success
 }
 
 EnumState<ProcessState> s = new EnumState<ProcessState>(ProcessState.Initialized);
 
 if (s.cas(ProcessState.Initialize, ProcessState.Running)) {
        // updated!
 }
 
 // locks entirely for more advanced state manipulation
 synchronized (s) {
        if (s.equals(ProcessState.Running)) {
                try {
                        // do something (small) that could throw an error
                        s.set(ProcessState.Success);
                }
                catch (Exception e) {
                        s.set(ProcessState.Error);
                }
                if (s.equals(Error)) {
                        // An error occurred!
                }
        }
 }

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Constructor Detail

EnumState

public EnumState()
Instantiates a new State machine.

EnumState

public EnumState(E initialState)
Instantiates a new State machine given its initial state.

Parameters:
initialState - The initial state(s) of the machine.
Method Detail

set

public void set(E newState)
Overrides the current state with the given state. If any thread is waiting for the provided state they will be notified and that thread will resume execution.

Parameters:
newState - The new state of the machine.

clear

public void clear()
Removes state (set to null) from this machine.

get

public E get()
Returns the state of the machine.

Returns:
The current state of the machine.

equals

public boolean equals(E exactState)
Determines whether this machine has the exact states given.

Parameters:
exactState - The state this machine must have exactly.
Returns:
True if this machine has the exact state, otherwise false.

cas

public boolean cas(E desiredState,
                   E newState)
Performs a Compare-And-Set on the state. If this machine has any of the desired states then this machine's state will be set to the newState.

Example

 EnumState<ProcessState> s = ...
 // if the state is running or waiting, set it to paused
 if (s.cas(ProcessState.Running, ProcessState.Paused)) {
        // state has been successfully paused!
 }

Parameters:
desiredState - The set of states to check if any exist.
newState - The new state(s) of the machine.
Returns:
True if this machine was set to the new state(s).

waitFor

public boolean waitFor(E desiredState)
Indefinitely waits for the given state to be reached. If the current thread is interrupted this will return before the state is reached.

Parameters:
desiredState - The state to wait for.
Returns:
True if the given state is reached, otherwise false.

waitFor

public boolean waitFor(E desiredState,
                       long timeout)
Waits for the given state to be reached, or for a specific amount of time to elapse. If the current thread is interrupted or the thread has waited more than the provided timeout time this will return before the state is reached.

Parameters:
desiredState - The state to wait for.
timeout - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the given state.
Returns:
True if the given state is reached, otherwise false.

wakeup

public void wakeup()
Notifies all threads waiting for a state. The waiting threads will be woken and one at a time they will check the state of the machine for their desired state.

lazySet

public void lazySet(E newState)
Overrides the current state with the given state. This will not obtain the state machine lock before setting the state. This should only be used if the invoking thread already has synchronized on this state state and will invoke wakeup() before the synchronized block ends.

Example

 EnumState<ProcessState> s = ...
 synchronized (s) {
        s.lazySet(ProcessState.Running);
        // other processing...
        s.wakeup();
 }

Parameters:
newState - The new state of the machine.

lazyEquals

public boolean lazyEquals(E otherState)
Compares the current state to the given state without blocking.

Returns:
True if the current state matches the given state.

lazyGet

public E lazyGet()
Returns the state of the machine. This will not obtain the state machine lock before setting the state. This should only be used if the invoking thread already has synchronized on this state.

Example

 EnumState<ProcessState> s = ...
 synchronized (s) {
        ProcessState state = s.lazyGet();
        // other processing...
 }

Returns:
The current state of the machine.

waitForChange

public E waitForChange()
Waits for any change in state and returns the new state. If the current thread is interrupted this may return the original state. This may be useful if a thread is waiting for a specific state.

Example

 EnumState<ProcessState> s = ...
 synchronized (s) {
        while (!s.equals(ProcessState.Waiting)) {
                s.waitForChange();
        }
 }

Returns:
The state of the machine.
